So long as fundamentals of science is not related to satisfaction of needs of beings, all these explanations and predictions through much glorified inquisity, imaginations and speculations is sheer waste of time and would only pave the way for more disasters .

The problem of war as well as other disastors human race faces has a far deeper cause than everybody believes.

It is rooted in the fundamentals of what all on this earth believe to be the means for acquiring knowledge:

EXPERIMENTAL AND OBSERVATIONAL SCIENCE WITHOUT ANY CLEARLY STATED PURPOSE.

This is comparable with going to a supermarket and analyzing everything available in it to find out what to buy. One must know what one needs before going to the supermarket. Otherwise one would buy all kinds of rubbish promoted by the seller.

That is exactly what our glorified experimental and observational science does at present: developing all kinds of nonliving tools without any idea about how LIFE develops.

There is no mathematical formula describing how a seed is composed from soil. The whole of glorified CALCULUS is useless when it comes to analyzing development of seeds from nonliving matter or growth of plants from them. Yet that is the only thing on which all life (including all carnivoures) depends every single day. Nobody even notices this absence (defect) in the fundamentals of science, glorified by everybody.

We must search for knowledge only to satisfy our own needs. This can only happen if we quantize our needs particle physically and link their satisfaction to plants by equally quantizing NUMBERS and interpreting the four elementary arithmetic operations as interactions among those quantized particles.

As weapons manufacture would be a fundamentally prohibited function in such a system and all knowledge must link to sustenance of PLANTS and ANIMALS eternally there can be no disasters or wars in that system.

This would require substituting the
general relativistic formula of the universe:

Spacetime curvature = matter and energy

with the particle physical formula of life function:

Needs = means of their satisfaction
= growth of and on plants

Until this is done we'd continue to waste our time analyzing one man made problem after another eternally, while natural disastors pile up on the other side and the greatist scientists fiddle analyzing the cuses of Big Bang, Dark Matter, Dark Energy, Black Holes,..... And the richest of them design machines to reach the stars and explore the universe; similar to the father, who wastes all what he earns in drinks and gambling while own children starve.

I enjoy these videos very much. I would like to see one illustrating actual observations of how life can come from non-life. We can observe how life becomes non-living (dies). This video readily admits that "unsettlingly, the universe wants us to reach the top (meaning die)." I interpret "wants us" to mean is working to kill us; or there are many more mechanisms that can readily kill us, as opposed to helping us stay alive. However, As far as I know, actually observing or replicating the creation of life from non-life is still an unprovable mystery that obviously did happen at least once, but no one has actually observed and conclusively replicated the mechanics. For all of our scientific knowledge, no one can create even one blade of grass, or a custom designed living cell from non-living parts. Not that very smart people haven't tried.

The chemical process of converting one larger molecules into two smaller ones is called analysis.
The chemical process of converting two smaller molecules into one larger one is called synthesis.
To achieve this, there needs to be something energetic causing it. Like electricity.
You can split salt into sodium and chlorine by basically electrocuting it. This is called electrolysis.
Merging two molecules with electricity is called electrosynthesis. You may see where I'm going with this
Electricity is not the only thing that can achieve this, electromagnetic radiation can two, electromagnetism is a force carried by photons. Splitting a molecule with a photon is called photolysis.
Merging two molecules using light is called
Photon + Synthesis
Photosynthesis
That is the origin of the name. The two major molecules being massively converted here are Carbon Dioxide (CO2) and Dihydrogen monoxide (Or just water, I'm sorry it's just to funny to say it like that). These contain all the atoms required to make glucose (C6H12O6). But they will only merge under the influence of photons, that's the photosynthesis part.
The chemical formula of this reaction is
Photons
6CO2 + 6H2O => C6H12O6 +6O2

This video is a mistake
The cell doesnt "have" to do anything.
The cell lives because keeping alive and reproducing itself keeps a cycle in tact.
When the force of entropy overcomes this cycle, the cell dies
If the cell succeeds in getting the nutrients it needs to stay alive, it lives another day.
The same is true on every scale.
Humans dont live because we want to live or survive.
We live because surviving "works"
We arent concious, we dont make desicions, there is no "we"
Living is just the act of sustaining the cycle that is "life"
Everything we do, every "desicion" we make is simply a chemical reaction in the brain

As a science channel, i think (<- Or not by my logic xd) you should stop personalizing all this stuff. It simply isnt personal, or human.
Its just a walking lump of meat that has sex so it can make another one of itself. It doesnt do this because it wants to, it just did because its parent did, Everything is in fact, evolution and natural selection.

I want to say something on the topic of ATP.

Now, I have a small issue with the way this video presented the information about the amount of ATP particles produced in the body in one day. I get that it's a hell of a lot, but the brain inherently rejects information it can't internally weave into the current narrative it already has of the world. He said the body produces your full bodyweight in ATP every day, and for a lot of people I feel like their brains will reject this information because they don't understand it and can't believe it, now, I have no former schooling on the topic so lets get that out in front as a disclaimer, but based on what I know about the world as a whole and the laws of physics as they are, this must mean the ATP particle is extremely recyclable, meaning your body is just moving these pieces around very rapidly to perform the tasks needed, this probably also means that the particle doesn't have a strong bond so it's easy to break it apart or fuse it up together, the chemical bonds require very little energy to make, I don't know why they are so easy to build though. But they are, they have to be or we couldn't make so many of them every day, all the time.

So in conclusion your body isn't just spontaneously generating new matter to make ATP with, it's just prodigiously good at recycling.

One problem: the simplest cells are already incredibly complex. And they would have to have been able to sustain themselves with ATP (or other forms of energy) immediately, before dying. Which is, as we have seen, also an incredibly complex process. The point that they must have sustained themselves with simple chemical reactions is purely theoretical, as no living cell we know actually functions like this.

Somehow the cell developed this all on its own without any guidance or help, in a fairly short time without returning to the dead universe, and also managed to divide perfectly over and over afterwards, simply because it resisted falling apart as it would otherwise have, in the presumably hostile circumstances we think it evolved in.

Whoever wrote the script needed to cut the whole "dead universe" theme because that was nihilist drivel that didn't tie into the video's subject as well as a theme about, say, life itself (framed as a question of curiosity and exploration, not as a blight on "the universe") or the function of cells. Talking about how there's nothing exciting (except for life) for several minutes does not make for engaging and intentional use of the video's time--even if they did try to make a weird psuedo-philosophical connection at the end. The video was interesting only from 4:00 to 9:22 because 1. it was about the video's subject and 2. the information was delivered in a way that was easy to understand, which I appreciate because I assume there are also children in your audience and they watch your videos to learn. That said, consider your audience next time because I doubt people click on an educational video to be told the universe is dead and boring and that only thing exciting about is life. That information is not valuable.

I didn't like the analogies used in this video. Also, I wasn't satisfied with their description of the mitochondria or ATP.

I would have preferred Kurzgesagt to elaborate on the inside-out origin for the eukaryotic cell. Basically the acquisition of the mitochondria occurred along side two other traits common to all eukaryotic cells; the nuclear membrane and the golgi apparatus/endoplasmic reticulum. Bacteria don't have any of these 3. The model suggests that the nuclear membrane was the original bacterial/archaeal membrane and that the outer cellular membrane came after. Which is evidenced by the continuous bi lipid membrane between the nuclear membrane and the endoplasmic reticulum, which are connected at the nuclear pore of the nuclear membrane. Basically, the first eukaryotes would have begun extending their cell membrane from the nuclear pore to form a number of other superfluous structures, likely growing around the first alphaproteobacteria that would become the mitochondria, rather than "eating" it, and the cellular membrane would have come after neatly tidying it all up. The evidence implies however that all three of these may have occurred in a single event.

Also, they could have elaborated on how ATP or adenosine triphosphate is really just an adenosine nucleoside with 3 phosphates popped on. And that there are 2 forms of phosphorylation that occur within the cell. ATP -> ADP, and ADP -> AMP. Almost like a redundant power system built into the cell.

Also, mitochondria don't just produce CO2, water and energy. They produce a number of reactive oxygen species and free radicals too, like carbon monoxide or nitrogen dioxide, albeit in very small amounts, but that these byproducts contribute to aging and mitochondrial disease. They really are like little car engines that operate at 50 degrees celcius and spewing out fumes, and unlike most organelles which are fixed in place by the cellular cytoskeleton, mitochondria constantly wriggle around the cell in between the cytoskeletal mesh holding everything together.

Finally, this would probably require a second video, but they mentioned the first cells coming together and I would really love a video on the nuclear geyser model for abiogenesis, which is the most likely model for the origins of life. It combines the best parts of the hydrothermal vent model and the shallow pool model and suggests that the ambient radiation of a freshly accreting Earth provided the ambient energy required for the light sensitive reactions required for the synthesis of lipids, amino acids and nucleosides (which really are just different arrangements of the same stuff, hence ATP being just one of those nucleotides except with phosphates popped onto it) as heavier materials settled in the Earth's mantle pushing up water, hydroden cyanide and hydrogen sulfide. All volatile materials found in meteor rock and that occur alongside water in space. Along with phosphates which is where the hydrothermal vents come in. But ATP actually occurs naturally in hydrothermal vents, and evolved in a many step process that started with the NADH+ metabolism present in most bacteria, but how mitochondria basically added 4 extra steps onto this 6 step process, totaling 10 in order to triple the efficiency of converting sugar into ATP. The video lumps all of these steps together, but in reality they likely occurred billions of years apart from each other. There has been more time between the evolution of the first cell and the evolution of the mitochondria, then there has been between the first amoeba and the first human.

Technically hydrocarbons are just improperly combusted amine and carboxyl groups. Its not just any amino acids that occur in living systems. Its the simplest ones. And once you can see the chemistry of it, its actually not that surprising at all that self assembling systems were able to form on their own. Cell membranes are basically liquid crystals, and proteins are basically polymer crystals after all. Lipids form micelles without external intervention. A lot like oil. And pure amino acids actually crystallize into dipolar structures with really interesting electrical properties. Not at all what most people would expect for the building blocks of life.

Even a video on the codon language would be interesting, and the properties of each amino acid. Amino acids generally fall into one of 4 groups; basic, acidic, polar and non polar. Basically the main properties that determine the function of an amino acid are what hydrogen/hydroxide groups are present and where. With all of this put into context it becomes a lot easier to visualize a cell as a random product of evolution rather than something that's meticulously designed. In reality the earliest proteins were probably just random residues and natural selection refined the rest from there. But a protein consisting of hundreds of thousands or perhaps millions of amino acids may only have 2 or 3 amino acids serving as a functional site for catalyzing chemical reactions while the rest of them are there for structure. As small as the cell is... its still incredibly big. With a lot of room for error.

At the end he says “the dead universe.” I truly do not believe that 19th century dogma that was invented to rationalize a world without a creator. This universe grew us like a tree grows a fruit. We are a hyper concentrated point of conscious experience, this gives rise to the idea that the self is something separate from the rest of the universe. But it isn’t. At all. We can not exist as living beings without an external environment to support that living being. Death is considered horrible to the individual; but as we are living proof lol...death hasn’t occurred in billions of years. Form has changed. Perspective has changed. But life has never been dead. And the same “dead” universe gave rise to the emergent complexity of living beings. To me this indicates that the universe that grows things such as mind and rationality and love and everything else in between...must at its ground state, be all those things itself. Because we ARE the entirety of the universe experiencing a very small and concentrated temporal event. We call them lives. But they are not separate from anything whatsoever. And they could not occur in a universe that’s “dead.” Quite the contrary; this universe is absolutely a living one. You are the proof of that. We don’t need to disparage ourselves or victimize ourselves for the sake of denying the probable truth...YOU are all that exists. But you, are everything mincing itself into many selves of varying form and varying levels of consciousness, in order to appreciate the sweeping majesty of your totality as a divine being. You’re alive. Therefore the universe must be too. Death of an individual doesn’t denote death altogether. We’ve been scraping at this truth for a long time. Only the ego gets in the way and makes itself the “whole story,” when in fact it’s just a minuscule portion of the whole story of you.

Biologist here, not thrilled with the animated design of ATP... an avatar more true to the chemical structure of ATP would be better, since the reason the molecule can carry so much energy is because of the structure of the phosphate bond. Also, I feel like even adding an extra line or two around the great endocytosis event that made mitochondria could have helped transition it better. Mentioning before it that "'some cells made sugar, some cells ate those cells'... and some cells ate the cells that ate the sugar making cells" or something similar... because as far as my understanding of this event goes, the idea is that the cells that eventually became mitochondria were cells that made ATP from sugar but did not make sugar via photosynthesis themselves. The endocytosis of the cells that could make sure via photosynthesis is what gave the universe chloroplasts and plants. The animation tries to show that it is not one of the sugar making cells itself that gets eaten, but I feel like another sentence or two in there could have helped clarify it.

This is an extraordinarily complicated subject that is challenging to study from a research perspective, let alone distill down to a cute and colorful video. So props for doing it as well as you have.

If the universe can make something out of nothing, can we do that? Since the universe did it, if the theory of that is true anyway, shouldn’t we be able to make the energy work the same way as how the original energy that formed the universe to create something (since the universe literally becoming something from nothing would mean it’s literally possible to do that)?

It's one thing to present science as "this is how far we know", and it's another to present it as "this is definitely what happened". I suggest that the former is preferable because most of the things we know via science keeps changing. Let's be careful about how we present things we didn't witness first-hand. How cells evolved is something we didn't witness first-hand, but how water forms from Hydrogen and Oxygen is something we know for sure as of this time in science. So, let's be careful how these things are presented.

There is a problem with the theory that photosynthesis cells evolved after animal cells and ATP. All our ATP in our body actually comes from the food we eat, and therefore plants. Plants make ATP for all animals to use (conserving energy.) So if photosynthesis cells make ATP, how could ATP exist without photosynthesized cells? But if it is assumed that cells did develop ATP without photosynthesis cells, the energy to make the ATP would have to come from somewhere, in accordance with the conservation of energy! Where would that energy come from? It would make sense that the energy would come from the sun. Thus, ATP might not have been able to develop without photosynthesized cells.

Introduction
O man! You should be aware that there are certain phrases which are commonly used and imply unbelief. The believers also use them, but without realizing their implications. We shall explain three of the most important of them.
The First:
"Causes create this."
The Second:
"It forms itself; it comes into existence and later ceases to exist."
The Third:
"It is natural; Nature necessitates and creates it."
Indeed, since beings exist and this cannot be denied, and since each being comes into existence in a wise and artistic fashion, and since each is not outside time but is being continuously renewed, then, O falsifier of the truth, you are bound to say either that the causes in the world create beings, for example, this animal; that is to say, it comes into existence through the coming together of causes, or that it forms itself, or that its coming into existence is a requirement and necessary effect of Nature, or that it is created through the power of One All-Powerful and All-Glorious. Since reason can find no way apart from these four, if the first three are definitely proved to be impossible, invalid and absurd, the way of Divine Unity, which is the fourth way, will necessarily and self-evidently and without doubt or suspicion, be proved true.
THE FIRST WAY
This to imagine that the formation and existence of things, creatures, occurs through the coming together of the causes in the universe. We shall mention only three of its numerous impossibilities.
First Impossibility
Imagine there is a pharmacy in which there are hundreds of jars and phials filled with quite different substances. A living potion and a living remedy are required from those medicaments. So we go to the pharmacy and see that they are to be found there in abundance, yet in great variety. We examine each of the potions and see that the ingredients have been taken in varying but precise amounts from each of the jars and phials, one ounce from this, three from that, seven from the next, and so on. If one ounce too much or too little had been taken, the potion would not have been living and would not have displayed its special quality. Next, we study the living remedy. Again, the ingredients have been taken from the jars in a particular measure so that if even the most minute amount too much or too little had been taken, the remedy would have lost its special property.
Now, although the jars number more than fifty, the ingredients have been taken from each according to measures and amounts that are all different. Is it in any way possible or probable that the phials and jars should have been knocked over by a strange coincidence or sudden gust of wind and that only the precise, though different, amounts that had been taken from each of them should have been spilt, and then arranged themselves and come together to form the remedy? Is there anything more superstitious, impossible and absurd than this? If an ass could speak, it would say: "I cannot accept this idea!", and would gallop off!
Similarly, each living being may be likened to the living potion in the comparison, and each plant to a living remedy. For they are composed of matter that has been taken in most precise measure from truly numerous and truly various substances. If these are attributed to causes and the elements and it is claimed, "Causes created these," it is unreasonable, impossible and absurd a hundred times over, just as it was to claim that the potion in the pharmacy came into existence through the phials being knocked over; by accident.
In Short:
The vital substances in this vast pharmacy of the universe, which are measured on the scales of Divine Determining and Decree of the All-Wise and Pre-Eternal One, can only come into existence through a boundless wisdom, infinite knowledge and all-encompassing will. The unfortunate person who declares that they are the work of blind, deaf and innumerable elements and causes and natures, which stream like floods; and the foolish, delirious person who claims that that wondrous remedy poured itself out when the phials were knocked over and formed itself, are certainly unreasonable and nonsensical. Indeed, such denial and unbelief is a senseless absurdity.
THE SECOND WAY
This is expressed by the phrase "It forms itself." It too involves many impossibilities and is absurd and impossible in many aspects. We shall explain three examples of these impossibilities.
First Impossibility
O you obstinate denier! Your egotism has made you so stupid that somehow you decide to accept a hundred impossibilities all at once. For you yourself are a being and not some simple substance that is inanimate and unchanging. You are like an extremely well-ordered machine that is constantly being renewed and a wonderful palace that is undergoing continuous change. Particles are working unceasingly in your body. Your body has a connection and mutual relations with the universe, in particular with regard to sustenance and the perpetuation of the species, and the particles that work within it are careful not to spoil that relationship nor to break the connection. In this cautious manner they set about their work, as though taking the whole universe into account. Seeing your relationships within it, they take up their positions accordingly. And you benefit with your external and inner senses in accordance with the wonderful positions that they take. If you do not accept that the particles in your body are tiny officials in motion in accordance with the law of the Pre-Eternal and All-Powerful One, or that they are an army, or the nibs of the pen of Divine Determining, with each particle as the nib of a pen, or that they are points inscribed by the pen of Power with each particle being a point, then in every particle working in your eye there would have to be an eye such as could see every limb and part of your body as well as the entire universe, with which you are connected. In addition to this, you would have to ascribe to each particle an intelligence equivalent to that of a hundred geniuses, sufficient to know and recognize all your past and your future, and your forbears and descendants, the origins of all the elements of your being, and the sources of all your sustenance.
To attribute the knowledge and consciousness of a thousand Plato's to a single particle of one such as you who does not possess even a particle's worth of intelligence in matters of this kind is a crazy superstition a thousand times over!
THE THIRD WAY
"Nature necessitates it; Nature makes it." This statement contains many impossibilities. We shall mention three of them by way of examples.
First Impossibility
If the art and creativity, which are discerning and wise, to be seen in beings and particularly in animate beings are not attributed to the pen of Divine Determining and Power of the Pre-Eternal Sun, and instead are attributed to Nature and force, which are blind, deaf and unthinking, it becomes necessary that Nature either should have present in everything machines and printing-presses for their creation, or should include in everything power and wisdom enough to create and administer the universe. The reason for this is as follows:
The sun's manifestations and reflections appear in all small fragments of glass and droplets on the face of the earth. If those miniature, reflected imaginary suns are not ascribed to the sun in the sky, it is necessary to accept the external existence of an actual sun in every tiny fragment of glass smaller than a match-head, which possesses the sun's qualities and which, though small in size, bears profound meaning; and therefore to accept actual suns to the number of pieces of glass.
In exactly the same way, if beings and animate creatures are not attributed directly to the manifestation of the Pre-Eternal Sun's Names, it becomes neciessary to accept that in each being, and especially animate beings, there lies a nature, a force, or quite simply a god that will sustain an infinite power and will, and knowledge and wisdom. Such an idea is the most absurd and superstitious of all the impossibilities in the universe. It demonstrates that a man who attributes the art of the Creator of the universe to imaginary, insignificant, unconscious Nature is without a doubt less conscious of the truth than an animal.
Risale-i Nur Collection 174 -
Author :Bediüzzaman Said Nursî

SEVENTH FLASH
Look! With little difficulty you can see the seals of the Single, Eternally Besought One on the page of the earth, so raise your head, open your eyes, and look too at the great book of the universe. You will see that on it as a whole a stamp of unity is read out which is as clear as it is big. For like the components of a factory or members of a palace or town, these beings support one another, stretch out their hands to assist one another, and answer the needs and requests of one another, saying: "Here I am, at your service!" Assisting one another, they work together in order. Joining efforts, they serve animate beings. Co-operating and turned a single goal, they obey an All-Wise Disposer. They conform to a rule of mutual assistance which is in force from the sun and moon, night and day, and winter and summer, to plants coming to the assistance of hungry and needy animals, and animals hastening to the assistance of weak, noble men, and even nutritious substances flying to assist delicate, weak infants and fruits, and particles of food passing to the assistance of the cells of the body. They show to anyone who is not altogether blind that they are acting through the strength of a single, most generous Nurturer, and at the command of a single most wise Disposer.
Thus, on the one hand this mutual support and assistance, this answering one another's needs, this mutual embracing, this subjugation, this order, testify decisively that beings are administered and organized by a single Disposer and are being impelled and directed by a single Nurturer. And on the other hand, this perfect grace within the universal wisdom to be seen plainly in the art of things; and the all-embracing mercy which shines within the providence; and the sustenance spread over that mercy and scattered so as to answer the needs of all living beings needy for sustenance; -these form a stamp of Divine unity so brilliant that anyone whose mind is not altogether extinguished will understand it and anyone who is not altogether blind will see it.
Yes, a veil of wisdom demonstrating intention, consciousness, and will, has covered the whole universe, and upon that veil of wisdom has been spread a veil of grace and favour exhibiting beneficence, adornment, embellishment, and benevolence; and over that adorned veil of favour a garment of mercy displaying flashes of making known and loved, of bestowal and the granting of gifts has enveloped the universe; and spread over that illuminated veil of universal mercy is a table of general provisions showing kindness and bestowal and benevolence and perfect compassion and fine nurturing and dominical favour.
Yes, all beings from particles to suns, whether individuals or species, or large or small, have been clothed in a magnificent shirt of wisdom embroidered with fruits and aims, benefits and purposes. And over the wisdom-displaying shirt, a garment of favour embroidered with flowers of grace and beneficence has been cut out in accordance with the stature of things; and over that ornamented garment of favour, a general table of sustenance has been set up, lit up with flashes of love, bestowal, affection, and the granting of gifts, to which the decorations of mercy have been attached, and which, together with bestowing those illuminated and jewel-encrusted decorations, is sufficient for all the groups of living beings on the face of the earth, and meets all their needs. Thus, this matter points to an All-Glorious Provider Who is All-Wise, All-Generous, and All-Compassionate, and shows Him as clearly as the sun.
Is that so? Is everything in need of sustenance?
Yes, like individual beings are in need of sustenance and all the necessities to continue their lives, we see that all the beings in the world, and especially living beings, whether universal or particular, wholes or parts, have many desires and needs, material and otherwise, for their existence, their lives, and the continuation of their lives. But their wants and needs are for such things that their hands cannot reach the least of them and their power is insufficient for the smallest of them. Yet, we see that all their wishes and material and immaterial sustenance is given to them From where he could not imagine, {[*]: Qur'an, 65:3.} from unhoped for places, with perfect order, at the appropriate time, in a suitable fashion, with perfect wisdom. And so, does this want and need of creatures and this manner of unseen help and assistance not show an All-Wise and Glorious Nurturer, an All-Compassionate Beauteous Disposer?
Risale-i Nur Collection Words - 309 Bediüzzaman Said Nursi (R. A)

In every particle there are two truthful evidences to the existence and unity of the Necessarily Existent One. Indeed, by carrying out its important duties consciously and by raising mighty loads despite being powerless and lifeless, a particle bear decisive witness to the existence of the Necessarily Existent One. And by conforming to the universal order peculiar to each place it enters, and by settling anywhere as though it was its homeland, it testifies to the unity of the Necessarily Existent One and to the oneness of that Being Who is the Owner of all things, with their apparent faces and their inner aspects which look to Him. That is to say, whoever owns the particles must also own all the places it enters.
Thus, since its loads are extremely heavy and its duties endless, the particle demonstrates that it is mobile and acting at the command of One Possessing Absolute Power, and in His name. And, the fact that it conforms as though knowingly to the universal order of the cosmos and enters each place without obstacle shows that it acts through the power and wisdom of a single Being Possessing Absolute Knowledge.
A private soldier has relations with his squad, his company, his battalion, his regiment, and his division, and so on, and has duties in connection with each. Since he knows all those relations and duties, he will act in conformity with them. For, having received training and instruction under military discipline, he complies with the rules and regulations of a single supreme commander who commands all those sections.
In the same way, all particles are suitably placed within compounds, and with every facet of the compounds have different beneficial relations and different well-regulated duties that yield wise results that are all different. It is therefore surely only One in the grasp of whose power is the whole universe who can place the particles in such a way as to preserve all their relations with and duties in all the facets of the compounds, and not spoil the wise results.
For example, a particle located in Tevfik's {(*): The first scribe of the Risale-i Nur.} eye is suitably placed with regard to the blood-vessels like the arteries and veins, and the motor and sensory nerves, and has a wise and purposeful relationship with the face, and then with the head, the trunk, and with the entire human body, and has beneficial duties in relation to each. This demonstrates that only one who creates all the members of the body will be able to place the particle in that position.
Particles entering the body as sustenance in the caravan of food in particular make their journey with astonishing order and wisdom. On their way, they pass through modes and stages in an orderly manner, and progressing consciously without confusion carry on till they are strained through the four filters in the bodies of animate beings. They are then loaded onto the red blood-corpuscles in order to come to the assistance of the members and cells which are in need of sustenance, rendering this assistance according to a law of generosity. It may be clearly understood from this that the One Who drives these particles and causes them to pass through thousands of different states must of necessity be a Generous Sustainer, a Compassionate Creator, in relation to Whose power particles and stars are equal.
Moreover, all particles act within embroideries of the greatest art and have relations with all the other particles therein. Since each is in a position of both dominance and subjection to all the rest, both to each individually and to all of them generally, it either knows and creates that wonderfully skilful embroidery and wisdom-displaying ornamented art, which is a thousand times impossible, or each of them is a point assigned to that motion, which proceeds from the law of Divine Determining and pen of power of the All-Wise Maker.
For example, if the stones of the dome of Aya Sophia are not dependent on the command and skill of its architect, all the stones must have skill in the art of building like that of the architect Sinan, and must be either subject to, or dominant over, the rest of the stones. That is, they must have the power to say: "Come, we shall stand shoulder to shoulder in order not to fall and collapse."
In the same way, if the particles in creatures, which are thousands of times more skilfully fashioned, wonderful, and full of wisdom than the dome of Aya Sophia, are not dependent on the command of the master builder of the universe, to each of them must the ascribed as many attributes of perfection as those of the universe's Maker.
Glory be to God! Since the unbelievers do not accept a Necessarily Existent One, they are compelled according to their beliefs to accept as many false gods as there are particles. Thus, no matter how illustrious a philosopher or scholar an unbeliever may be, he is in profound ignorance to the utmost degree.

The reason you don't use your body weight in food everyday is because ATP turns into ADP when its energy is used up. Then the body uses energy from glucose to turn ADP back into ATP. So in a day you're not making 90 million billion billion whole ATP molecules and using the whole thing. You just cycle ATP to ADP then back into ATP 90 million billion billion times

I am interested in a project which involves a lot of math. In the Bible, in Genesis 1:6,7, it states that before humans existed there was a canopy of water which surrounded the earth; a bubble of water above our atmosphere which surrounded the entire planet. This situation existed until the flood of Noah's day at which time God allowed the earth to be flooded with those waters above and the floodgates underneath the surface of the ground as well. (Genesis 6:11) During the time the "bubble/layer of water existed, the lifespan of humans regularly reached into the 900th year. But, after this canopy/shield of water was taken away, human lifespan dropped significantly; 279 years after the canopy of water was taken away.
If you were to model this phenomena mathematically, I wonder what would be the effect on gravity on the earth's surface. This canopy/water shield atmosphere was the atmosphere humans were made to live in and may the optimal conditions for true human gene expression. Many human genetic functions may not even 'turn on' without this atmosphere. And the thickness of this canopy, from inches to potentially feet thick may vary the possible solutions.
I know you are a smart guy and find solutions to difficult problems; this is one which may have exponential benefits if delved into and solved. If you are not interested, bring this up to a colleague who may be interested in such a possibility.

Hello Kurzgesagt, I'm an AP Biology student and aspiring medical doctor. As always, I am very impressed with this video! It's an excellent summary of evolutionary history, the endosymbiotic theory, and the fundamental processes of cellular energetics, but I do have one thing to point out:
I know you were trying to keep things simple, but it's important to note that cells rarely create ATP molecules from scratch, as you seemed to imply. Rather, one of the molecule's three inorganic phosphates is removed to release energy, converting ATP to ADP (adenosine diphosphate). During cellular respiration, inorganic phosphates are recombined with ADP molecules, forming ATP. In other words, ATP is used and reused. If cells had to constantly make ATP from scratch, it would likely be impossible for us to eat enough food to survive each day.

Luv u kurzgesagt but I didn't love this video... I'm not sure exactly why, but I think if you had released the entropy video first, you could've been more precise and deep when answering the question of why we're alive. All I was hoping for was a broad presentation of Schrodinger's ideas, but it came short. Also, I don't understand why so much emphasis on ATP, what am I missing? To me, ATP had always been a convenient way of converting and transporting energy, making it available for use by the cell (think exergy). Thus, the concept of availability is much more important in my mind, and this point didn't become clear in the video. And finally, the coil toy metaphor just doesn't seem right... The logic seem lopsided. Maybe the stairs should be going down, and you need a constant source of available energy to keep climbing it up and avoiding death... Well, it's just that this topic is very dear to me lol. Luv u!

In May 2019, members of the Minnesota House of Representatives and the Minnesota Senate sent official letters to the Minnesota Medical Association (MMA) expressing concern over forced organ harvesting in China.

The letters from the House of Representatives and the Minnesota Senate, written by Representative Nels Pierson (R-Stewartville) and Senator Jim Abeler (R-Anoka), were supported by 77 House and Senate co-signers, two of whom are practicing physicians. Both letters expressed concern over Minnesota residents obtaining unethically sourced organs from countries such as China and also mentioned concern over, “…Chinese medical personnel who are trained in Minnesota that may assist in forced organ harvesting.”

The MMA is a non-profit professional association that represents Minnesota physicians, residents, and medical students.

From a Minnesota government press release:

“We need a plan and guideline to prevent anyone from profiting from this horrendous practice in China,” said Sen. Abeler (R-Anoka). “It is vital that we continue to condemn forced harvesting and discourage our citizens from taking advantage of this crime against humanity. Senator Carolyn Laine (DFL-Columbia Heights) declared, “This is a serious human rights issue and we all need to take a vocal stand on this practice.”

The Minnesota legislature has focused on the issue of the persecution and forced organ harvesting from Falun Gong practitioners since 2014. In that year, members of the Minnesota House of Representatives wrote a letter to the Minnesota Department of Health and the Minnesota Office of Higher Education. The letter inquired about any potential collaboration between China and Minnesota regarding organ transplantation.

Great video overall; I really liked it. But (and someone probably has already commented this), I think the timeline with the appearances of the chloroplast and mitochondrion is a little goofed-up. From what I remember from Biology and Botany, the first cells were most likely chemosynthetic ones living off hydrothermal vents (underwater volcanoes). That much matches, but since both all plants and all animals (and all fungi and most protists) have mitochondria, that means that all these different kinds of life would have the same common ancestor at the cell that first absorbed the mitochondrion. So, (I think) there wouldn't have been chloroplasts or photosynthesis at the time mitochondria first appeared, because all the photosynthetic cells with chloroplasts also need mitochondria to process the glucose produced by photosynthesis.


If I'm wrong, feel free to correct me, but I looked a few things up for clarification and I'm pretty sure that's more accurately how it happened. And I guess you could maybe chalk up these discrepancies to just simplifying the concepts, but it looks like the video is heavily implying that mitochondria are unique to animals alone, and be that intentional or not, I'm pretty sure that isn't right.

The answer is that life can decrease entropy inside its body while increasing it outside of it, so it still follows the law. Well we do know why energy cannot be created or destroyed, at least from a methametical perspective. There's this thing called Noether's theorem that says for any symmetry of a physical system, there is a conserved quantity. Most physical theories have time translation symmetry, which basically says that if you do an experiment at different times, you should get the same result. Pretty much every theory has to be time translation invariant, because if your theory changes with time, there's not much you can predict with it. Energy is the conserved quantity associated with time translation. Depending on the theory, the mathematical expression for energy may be different, but we know that as long as your physical system doesn't depend on time, there's something that's conserved, and we call that thing energy.

We do know why energy is conserved. It's hard to explain in a comment since it's very mathy but, the long and short of it is this. For every symmetry in our universe there is an conserved value AND for every conserved value there exists a symmetry. So if the universe works the same if your moving left as if you were moving right, there must be a value that is conserved (it's momentum). Therefore if Energy is conserved then there must be a conserved value associated with it. It's time. The universe works the same today as it did 100 years ago and will work the same 100 years in the future. This is called Noether's Theorem if you want to learn more.

I sort of disagree that entropy wants us dead, actually I believe we are, in some ways, a tool for entropy. Every actor of energy transformation is a contributor to the increase of entropy, in this way life is, like stars, one of multiple probable outcomes when the right conditions are met to the increase of entropy.

In another words:
If we consider that the stars pick simple atoms and transform it in heat, light and chemicals, and we, ourselves, transform chemical energy (+ light) in heat (or another chemicals), life could be considered a step after stars to the increase in entropy

Great video, as usual. However I have some objections as a biochemist. First mitochondria do not consume glucose but semi-oxidized products of lipids and glucose. Therefore it is dependent on cytoplasmic metabolic reactions (glycolysis) to function as an energy producing unit. Secondly carbohydrates (sugar molecules) are stored on almost all cells but not much in adipocytes (fat cells). Fat cells store lipids (as the name suggests) which can be broken down to produce energy in mitochondria but cannot be used to synthesize carbohydrates.

Just a thought about the first cell ever. We don't know if the first life was a cell or something simpler. We don't know if the first life existed and then died without replicating. Contrarily we also don't know if replication came first and then became life, although I see no way that could be the case.

What we do know is that numerous attempts over the past several decades to produce life from non-life have all ended the exact same way: Clumps of matter that sit there lifelessly. I wish I had a dollar for every time in the past 40 years I have heard that we are “3 years away” from creating life from scratch elements. Then they go on to talk about primordial soup, thermal vents or lighting strikes.

The fact remains that there is no possibility that intelligence can be caused by non-intelligent accident. The very idea of unintentional intention is oxymoronically impossible. Although physicalists try desperately to wiggle around it, there is no remotely possible explanation for life that does not involve intelligent agency as a starting point and every point on from there as well.

So the first cell did exist and it was as intelligent as cells still are today, and it was caused by intelligence. I could be wrong but I can think of no reason to think otherwise

The only thing I have an issue with is the constant repetition of "the dead universe". Death is reserved for things which have been alive. A rock is not dead because it was never alive to begin with. The same can be said of space itself; it doesn't even consist of matter, so there isn't even a possibility of it becoming alive, let alone dying. To say the universe is "dead" is to say that it once was alive. And who's to say death is boring anyway? Nobody has ever come back to tell us about it, so how can you rule out the possibility that those who have died are having a better time than those who are still alive? Picture this:
There's life in the ocean.

What?

Somethings alive in the ocean.

Oh cool, is it a plant or an animal?

No, a microscopic speck. It lives at the bottom of the ocean and eats chemical soup which is being served hot and fresh, made from gnarly space ingredients leftover from when it was raining rocks or whatever.

Oh yeah, it can do that.

It has secret instructions written inside itself telling it how to build another one of itself. So that's pretty nifty, I would say.

Tired of living at the bottom of the ocean?

Now you can eat sunlight!

Using a revolutionary technique, you can convert sunlight into food.

Taste the sun!

Side effect, now there's oxygen everywhere and the sky is blue.

Then the Earth might have been a snowball for a while. Maybe even a couple of times.

It's a sponge. It's a plant. It's a worm, and some other types of weird, strange water bugs and strange fish.

It's the Cambrian explosion!

Wow, that's animals and stuff.

But we're still in the ocean. Hey, can we go on land?

No!

Why?

The sun is a deadly laser!

Oh, okay.

Not anymore, there's a blanket.

Now the animals can go on land. Come on animals, let's go on land.

Nope, can't walk yet. And there's no food yet, so I don't care.

Okay, will you learn to walk if there's plants up here?

Maybe

...said some bugs... and fish.

Physics student here! Just thought I'd make a comment on 2:33 - this isn't entirely true. The conservation of energy is a result of Noether's theorem, which says that things are conserved when there is a certain symmetry. In this case, time-symmetric systems exhibit conservation of energy. However, the universe isn't actually time-symmetric as it is expanding, so energy is only approximately conserved on very large scales, and there are rare cases where energy is not conserved (eg redshifting).

I'm not really happy with this video because of the oversimplifications being made. I'm not upset at oversimplifying things to better educate a broader audience, but more at how you made those oversimplified things sound.
I understand that the statement "life is separate from the universe" is made to illustrate how cellular processes seem to contradict the law of entropy, but that language also can reinforce the falsehood that we as humans, or as living beings, are somehow separate from nature/the world/the universe, when it is in fact the opposite. We, as humans and living beings, are so intrinsically connected with our environment, the world, and the universe, that it'd border on deliberate obfuscation of that fact to imply otherwise, even just for a brief demonstration.
The way you say things matters and it will alter how people see the world around them.
edit: And I'm not saying this in a spiritualistic way, I'm saying this in a very real, very concrete way. Philosophies that imply humans are separate from nature because of some unmeasurable quality that we have has done more harm to the earth's ecosystem than any other philosophy or religion on earth. It's why overexploitation of the land and its resources is so commonplace, because of some blind, irrational feeling that we are given 'dibs' on any and all resources we can find, even if they're increasingly rare and inefficient to obtain, refine, and use as society progresses (looking at you, fossil fuels).
It's dangerous to continue this falsehood and I implore that you think about how people will ingest what you say, even if you don't intend any other meaning.

What is ATP and its function?
ATP, which stands for adenosine triphosphate, is a biomolecule formed by a purine base (adenine), a sugar molecule (ribose) and three phosphate groups. Its main function is to store energy within the cell. ... ATP hydrolysis is an exotermic reaction, releasing energy which is used by the cell.

So Prokaryotic cells are cells without organelles (Mitochondria, golgi, etc). The fusion of two Prokaryotes (Mitochondria and whatever enveloped it) created Eukaryotes, the cells we are made from. However, our tissues and organs are a symphony of structured and specialised Eukaryotes. 'Super organisms' are when multicellular organism can work in near perfect tandem, like ant colonies & bee hives, but each actual organism is discrete (divisible, like how essential we can be divided into the trillions of cells that constitute us.) If we as multicellular organisms could workout how to fuse together, like in Dragon Ball Z, that would be the next higher order lifeform. To think, we currently possess a layer of neuronal consciousness (our brains), but our cells are essentially biological machines (operating in a non-conscious manner). So our consciousness is a product, a phenomenological spin out of layered non-consciousness. To layer two entities with consciousness as we understand today would result in something I don't think our wildest imaginations could ever envisage.

I’m not a huge fan of this understanding of entropy. It’s definitely very widespread and not incorrect, but Entropy is more about the probability of various states (here, there, this much energy, that much energy, etc) and then that the universe tends to move toward the likeliest possibility. Gas spreads through a room because although there’s nothing stopping it from clumping in a ball, it’s like 24 orders of magnitude more probable that it’s spread evenly; and when we measure it, it is. Likewise it’s much more probabilistically likely to find a clump of inert organic matter than You.

Ecc.12: 1Don’t let the excitement of youth cause you to forget your Creator. Honor him in your youth before you grow old and say, “Life is not pleasant anymore.” 

2Remember him before the light of the sun, moon, and stars is dim to your old eyes, and rain clouds continually darken your sky. 

3Remember him before your legs—the guards of your house—start to tremble; and before your shoulders—the strong men—stoop. Remember him before your teeth—your few remaining servants—stop grinding; and before your eyes—the women looking through the windows—see dimly.

4Remember him before the door to life’s opportunities is closed and the sound of work fades. Now you rise at the first chirping of the birds, but then all their sounds will grow faint.

5Remember him before you become fearful of falling and worry about danger in the streets; before your hair turns white like an almond tree in bloom, and you drag along without energy like a dying grasshopper, and the caperberry no longer inspires sexual desire. Remember him before you near the grave, your everlasting home, when the mourners will weep at your funeral.

6Yes, remember your Creator now while you are young, before the silver cord of life snaps and the golden bowl is broken. Don’t wait until the water jar is smashed at the spring and the pulley is broken at the well. 

7For then the dust will return to the earth, and the spirit will return to God who gave it.
Concluding Thoughts about the Teacher

8“Everything is meaningless,” says the Teacher, “completely meaningless.”

9Keep this in mind: The Teacher was considered wise, and he taught the people everything he knew. He listened carefully to many proverbs, studying and classifying them. 

10The Teacher sought to find just the right words to express truths clearly.

11The words of the wise are like cattle prods—painful but helpful. Their collected sayings are like a nail-studded stick with which a shepherd drives the sheep.

12But, my child, let me give you some further advice: Be careful, for writing books is endless, and much study wears you out.

13That’s the whole story. Here now is my final conclusion: Fear God and obey his commands, for this is everyone’s duty. 

14God will judge us for everything we do, including every secret thing, whether good or bad

THE POWERHOUSE OF THE CELL ⚡⚡

I've always found it amazing when you look at a sample of water from say, a pond, and can see all of those tiny creatures living out their lives through a microscope.  Look at it the next day, and they're still there swimming around, and yet every single one from the day before has since died.  What you're looking at is their offspring.  I think as humans, our long lives makes us somewhat oblivious to this fact, but there is a massive chain of lifeforms stretching back through time to the very first lifeform, and the only reason you're here reading this is because it managed to trick nature and entropy, by simply making a copy of itself to keep going after it had failed. Great Video to teach people the basics of biotic energy. You briefly touched on it, but all energy process produce heat energy! This heat radiation that produced is due to entropy. When you use 1 atp of energy for a process, some of that energy is lost as heat. Meaning ALL ENERGY TRANSFERS ARE INEFFICIENT.

Why is this important? Well this process has a direct impact on our food supply. When you eat a piece of chicken, 90% of that chickens energy is lost and we only utilize 10% of that energy to biomass. That chicken had to eat plants, and it was only about to use 10% of the plants energy for its biomass. This means that if humans ate the plants directly, it would be a 90% more energy efficient process!

This is called the Ten Percent Law in ecology. So if we want to solve world hunger, eating plants is essential! Just another reason that eating meat isn't very good for the planet.

The Benatarian asymmetry demonstrates why it is always better never to exist, regardless of the pleasure to pain ratio in one’s life. Whereas:
1. The presence of pleasure is good, and
2. The presence of pain is bad;
3. The absence of pain is good even if one does not exist to benefit from that good, but
4. The absence of pleasure is not bad unless someone already exists for which such an absence would be a deprivation.

Given the above, it is always a harm to come into existence and reproduction is never morally justified. For a more in depth look I highly recommend reading Better Never to Have Been: The Harm of Coming into Existence by Dr. David Benatar (professor and chairman of philosophy at the University of Cape Town).

The evolutionary tree at 6:13 contains a serious error, in that it depicts some mushrooms at the lower left of the tree near the plants when fungi are actually much more closely related to animals than to plants (nearly next-door neighbors within one of the three major branches of the eukaryotic lineage; plants and most algae belong to a different branch and so cannot claim a common ancestor more recent than the cell that did not kill the other cell it ate.) I know it's such a minor detail, almost completely irrelevant, within the scope of the video, but it would still be nice to see this addressed.

This video makes me so confused, what are you trying to convey? Philosophical or biological? You are introducing ATP but you never talk about how it was used, where is it from. For a video introducing ATP, it is terrible.

ATP gives energy from breaking down. ATP turns into ADP (Adenosine diphosphate)+ Pi (phosphate group) and gives out energy. Energy is stored vice versa. This would be a very simple and good information yet you used the time to talk about empty universe and lively cell.

ADP is synthesized from your gene along with AMP (Another molecule that can turn into ATP), that is why you can make more even though it is unknown where the first ATP came from. You didn't talk about this for slinkies on an escalator.

The thing that disappoints me in this video is you mixed a philosophical topic with an introductory video. Yes, life exists because of energy and cells, but what does that have to do with entropy and wanting to be lively. When you are talking about the importance of ATP, why do you not talk about the basics of ATP and say: yay mitochondria, yay energy.

This should have been two topics. Why life is here, and the other is ATP. Yet you mix them together and created a confusing video. When am I getting informative videos like you made in the past, instead of low effort research and teaching information that is widely available online? Then continue to preach how long you have researched when you can just type that in online and make a passage in less than an hour. That infuriates me.

I am already not requesting you to mention Kreb's cycle or Calvin cycle. But the basics of the use of ATP was never mentioned other than 'it gives energy', I would say this whole video, eleven and a half minute long only told me: ATP exists and gives energy to let you live. That's it, and you say you done research for so hard? Don't make me laugh.

Chemistry major here. For funzies i calculated the amound of ATP produced and consumed by the body a day. this was done according to the number of ATP mollecules given by the video

If we want to know how much kilograms of
ATP is synthesized and consumed in the body a day, we need to calculate the number
of moles.

90.000.000.000.000.000.000.000.000 ATP
molecules a day is equal to 149,45 moles of ATP. this is because one mol is equal
to 6.022^23 molecules. One mol of ATP it equal to 507,81 grams. This makes 75.772,2
grams of ATP that is about 75.8 kilograms of ATP produced and consumed in the
body a day.

i am happy to expain the calculation if nessesary and would love to hear any feedback.

Actually, we do know why energy is conserved. It is a consequence of time symmetry. As long as the laws of physics don’t change based on when you do your experiment, a concept called energy is conserved. Similarly, as long as the laws of physics don’t change based on where you do your experiment, momentum is conserved. There is some conceptual quantity conserved for every such statement of symmetry. And if it is not so in some other universe, life would not be able to evolve there, as life depends on the rules not changing while it slowly figures them out via evolution.

I'm just saying you simplified the physics at the start of the video, quite a bit (which is okay, but please mention it like you did for other things later in the video).
First of all the entropy principle you talked about, is called the second law of thermodynamics which states that a quantity called entropy can only grow or stay the same overtime in a closed system, never decrease.
As far as I know there are two ways to define entropy (disorder is not one of them although it is a common misconception).
The first is the amount of energy available to do work or how concentrated is energy at one region, the bigger this quantities are, the smaller the entropy.
The second way is the amount of possible microstates (stuff like arrangements of atoms and their velocities, quantities too small to see directly), that can create the observed macrostate (the statistical properties we can measure like temperature and I think density), the more microstates that can create the observed macrostate, the higher the entropy.
The reason the second law of thermodynamics is true, is known, it is because the higher the entropy, the more possible microstates are there, for the given macrostate, and it is simply statistically more likely for a system to evolve into one of the many possible microstates possible with high entropy macrostates, then to evolve into one of the few possible microstates possible with low entropy macrostates.
Also there is a reason for energy conservation, it's called nother's theorem which states that for every continuous symmetry in a system, there is a corresponding conservation law, which in the case of energy, the symmetry is time transitional symmetry (although I guess you can argue that we don't no why the universe has this symmetry) which states (as far as I understand it), that laws of physics don't change from one instance of time to the next.
For more info on both topics, I recommend the YouTube channel PBS Space Time.

I might have gotten something wrong here (and this might become a pet peeve of mine), In the beginning of the video you state that energy is the ability to do work and that the amount of energy in the universe does not change (conservation of energy). I believe this point to be confusing since this would imply that the potential to do work does change…which is obviously not true (second law of thermodynamics)…


You are not wrong either, because I am pretty sure you are just referring to an energy differential being the ability to do work (and differentials and absolutes use the same unit)…I've heard similar explanations before and TBH they confused the heck out of me until at some point I understood the point about differentials vs absolutes…

To clarify: the way we synthetise ATP is mostly by adding phosphate to ADP, which is just ATP with 2 phosphates instead of 3, so we are not producing ATP molecules from scratch. Also, used up ATP cells turn back into ADP, so it partially recycles itself. Thats why we "synthetise" our body weigh's worth of ATP without actually needing to ingest nearly that much mass in food.

I find it irritating that there are people that cannot get by the thought of that it IS possible for randomness to turn into accidental structure in which can create life such as a living cell.
Often they will think like "Oh but that's so random and it doesn't seem likely" but yes it is, do you understand how freaking big the universe is??? there's all chance in the world for it to happen multiple times and scattered throughout the universe. Just cause you're so familiar with existing doesn't make it less likely of a chance that life was created randomly. It's just your perspective that makes it seem unlikely. You feel like you're special cause you cannot trace it back or the universe is so big that it won't allow you to see it occur in other places. You feel like it's impossible and that if it would happen, then why would it happen right here now? Cause it's random. Random is random but it won't feel like as if it's random just cause it happened to you or your species cause you are able to observe it. You would never be able to have these thoughts or experiences for example if that chance never had existed at all . This is called the Anthropic Principle look into it people.

Hi Kurzgesagt, I know u probably deliberately didn't delve into more detail. But ATP is not the main energy source of any cell. Cell gain energy by moving electrons and generating proton gradients. Glucose isn't an alternative to ATP, any molecule containing a good number of carbon atoms (in reduced form) is a candidate for energy reservoir.
ATP It's just the main energy sink of a cell. Its chemistry isn't all that mysterious either. Energy is stored in the TP(tri-phosphate) part of ATP. Chemically -PO4, the phosphate is what called a good leaving group. Which means anything containing a -PO4 will naturally want to break down. But three phosphate groups together make a resonance stabilized structure which makes it kinetically stable. This means breaking a TP will yield lots of energy but u need a pretty big hammer to break it. U may then ask why just tri-phosphate, why not tetra, Penta, etc phosphate? The answer is the resonance stabilization from di-phosphate to tri-phosphate is huge, but from tri to tetra and Penta is proportionally not that much. So tri-phosphate is a good balance.

Then they use CO2 and other trace elements to make all the good stuff like glucose and other things.

It's not really correct to use entropy though in this video. With entropy always increasing ways in which to arrange possible states it begs the question why cells would come together and do what they do because basically a cell decreases entropy. One could be then wondering how life can be there at all because entropy should always increase, shouldn't it? But that reasoning would be forgetting that we have this giant thermonuclear furnace, called the sun, nearby that it constantly adding energy to our planet. So locally around earth our entropy is not increasing its actual decreasing. Over fast amounts of time though, eventually entropy works the way we've learned in textbooks.

While the line "This is one of the biggest betrayals in anime history" is undoubtedly funny, this is rather unnecessary alienation for people who are already unaware of the subject matter at hand.

If I wanted to show this to people, I know a fair few that would balk at the subject matter of this video. Already we are hugely simplifying a supremely complex and not fully known concept, further introducing a niche cultural joke undermines the attempts of this video to remain simple. It's another layer of confusion and complexity that, once explained, is likely to upset those that wondered what it all meant in the first place.

I love you guys and gals at Kurzgesagt and I am lucky to understand the reference being made. However, as your goal is to make content that is accessible, that bit of narration does not sit well. Keeping the background gag of Omae wa mo shinderu is fine though I think.

A piece from a new book titled Saved by the Light of Buddha Within.
Myoho-Renge-Kyo represents the identity of what some scientists are now referring to as the unified field of consciousnesses. In other words, it’s the essence of all existence and non-existence – the ultimate creative force behind planets, stars, nebulae, people, animals, trees, fish, birds, and all phenomena, manifest or latent. All matter and intelligence are simply waves or ripples manifesting to and from this core source. Consciousness (enlightenment) is itself the actual creator of everything that exists now, ever existed in the past, or will exist in the future – right down to the minutest particles of dust – each being an individual ripple or wave. The big difference between chanting Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo and most other conventional prayers is that instead of depending on a ‘middleman’ to connect us to our state of inner enlightenment, we’re able to do it ourselves. That’s because chanting Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo allows us to tap directly into our enlightened state by way of this self-produced sound vibration.
‘Who or What Is God?’ If we compare the concept of God being a separate entity that is forever watching down on us, to the teachings of Nichiren, it makes more sense to me that the true omnipotence, omniscience and omnipresence of what most people perceive to be God, is the fantastic state of enlightenment that exists within each of us. Some say that God is an entity that’s beyond physical matter – I think that the vast amount of information continuously being conveyed via electromagnetic waves in today’s world gives us proof of how an invisible state of God could indeed exist. For example, it’s now widely known that specific data relayed by way of electromagnetic waves has the potential to help bring about extraordinary and powerful effects – including an instant global awareness of something or a mass emotional reaction. It’s also common knowledge that these invisible waves can easily be used to detonate a bomb or to enable NASA to control the movements of a robot as far away as the Moon or Mars – none of which is possible without a receiver to decode the information that’s being transmitted. Without the receiver, the data would remain impotent. In a very similar way, we need to have our own ‘receiver’ switched on so that we can activate a clear and precise understanding of our own life, all other life and what everything else in existence is. Chanting Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo each day helps us to achieve this because it allows us to reach into the core of our enlightenment and keep it switched on. That’s because Myoho-Renge-Kyo represents the identity of what scientists now refer to as the unified field of consciousnesses.
To break it down – Myoho represents the Law of manifestation and latency (Nature) and consists of two alternating states. For example, the state of Myo is where everything in life that’s not obvious to us exists – including our stored memories when we’re not thinking about them – our hidden potential and inner emotions whenever they’re dormant – our desires, our fears, our wisdom, happiness, karma – and more importantly, our enlightenment. The other state, ho, is where everything in Life exists whenever it becomes evident to us, such as when a thought pops up from within our memory – whenever we experience or express our emotions – or whenever a good or bad cause manifests as an effect from our karma. When anything becomes apparent, it merely means that it’s come out of the state of Myo (dormancy/latency) and into a state of ho (manifestation). It’s the difference between consciousness and unconsciousness, being awake or asleep, or knowing and not knowing.
The second law – Renge – Ren meaning cause and ge meaning effect, governs and controls the functions of Myoho – these two laws of Myoho and Renge, not only function together simultaneously but also underlie all spiritual and physical existence.
The final and third part of the tri-combination – Kyo, is the Law which allows Myoho to integrate with Renge – or vice verse. It’s the great, invisible thread of energy that fuses and connects all Life and matter – as well as the past, present and future. It’s also sometimes termed the Universal Law of Communication – perhaps it could even be compared with the string theory that many scientists now suspect exists.
Just as the cells in our body, our thoughts, feelings and everything else is continually fluctuating within us – all that exists in the world around us and beyond is also in a constant state of flux – constantly controlled by these three fundamental laws. In fact, more things are going back and forth between the two states of Myo and ho in a single moment of time than it would ever be possible to calculate or describe. And it doesn’t matter how big or small, famous or trivial anything or anyone may appear to be, everything that’s ever existed in the past, exists now or will exist in the future, exists only because of the workings of the Laws ‘Myoho-Renge-Kyo’ – the basis of the four fundamental forces, and if they didn’t function, neither we nor anything else could go on existing. That’s because all forms of existence, including the seasons, day, night, birth, death and so on, are moving forward in an ongoing flow of continuation – rhythmically reverting back and forth between the two fundamental states of Myo and ho in absolute accordance with Renge – and by way of Kyo. Even stars are dying and being reborn under the workings of what the combination ‘Myoho-Renge-Kyo’ represents.
Nam, or Namu – which mean the same thing, are vibrational passwords or keys that allow us to reach deep into our life and fuse with or become one with ‘Myoho-Renge-Kyo’. On a more personal level, nothing ever happens by chance or coincidence, it’s the causes that we’ve made in our past, or are presently making, that determine how these laws function uniquely in each of our lives – as well as the environment from moment to moment. By facing east, in harmony with the direction that the Earth is spinning, and chanting Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo for a minimum of, let’s say, ten minutes daily to start with, any of us can experience actual proof of its positive effects in our lives – even if it only makes us feel good on the inside, there will be a definite positive effect. That’s because we’re able to pierce through the thickest layers of our karma and activate our inherent Buddha Nature (our enlightened state). By so doing, we’re then able to bring forth the wisdom and good fortune that we need to challenge, overcome and change our adverse circumstances – turn them into positive ones – or manifest and gain even greater fulfilment in our daily lives from our accumulated good karma. This also allows us to bring forth the wisdom that can free us from the ignorance and stupidity that’s preventing us from accepting and being proud of the person that we indeed are – regardless of our race, colour, gender or sexuality. We’re also able to see and understand our circumstances and the environment far more clearly, as well as attract and connect with any needed external beneficial forces and situations. As I’ve already mentioned, everything is subject to the law of Cause and Effect – the ‘actual-proof-strength’ resulting from chanting Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo always depends on our determination, sincerity and dedication. For example, the levels of difference could be compared to between making a sound on a piano, creating a melody, or producing a great song, and so on. Something else that’s very important to always to respect and acknowledge is that the Law (or if you prefer God) is in everyone and everything.

NB: There are frightening and disturbing sounds, and there are tranquil and relaxing sounds. It’s the emotional result from any noise or sound that can trigger off a mood or even instantly change one. When chanting Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo each day, we are producing a sound vibration that’s the password to our true inner-self – this soon becomes apparent when you start reassessing your views on various things – such as your fears and desires etc. The best way to get the desired result when chanting is not to view things in a conventional way – rather than reaching out to an external source, we need to reach into our own lives and bring our needs and desires to fruition from within – including the good fortune and strength to achieve any help that we may need.
Chanting Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo also reaches out externally and draws us towards, or draws towards us, what we need to make us happy from our environment. For example, it helps us to be in the right place at the right time – to make better choices and decisions and so forth. We need to think of it as a seed within us that we’re watering and bringing sunshine to for it to grow, blossom and bring forth fruit or flowers. It’s also important to understand that everything we need in life – including the answer to every question and the potential to achieve every dream – already exists within us.

Entropy has to have an exception to the rule tho. Or better, it has to have a catch. One of the main theories on how the universe has formed is that in the complete void of space, particles of matter and antimatter continuously formed from nothing, existed for a fraction of time, and then annihilated into nothing again. But over billions of years, one of the 2 halves, the one we now call matter, has to have prevailed on the other half, and started forming more complex particles which then formed more matter until there was enough matter for the Big Bang to happen.


If this theory is true, it is technically possible to create matter from nothing, which would mean there is a way to circumvent the course of entropy.

So why not mention ATP's other function (still super important): being an easy source of donatable phosphate groups for switching proteins between active and inactive states, due to conformational changes from steric interactions between the phosphate group and the surrounding amino acids? It seems like an easier concept to understand than being a source of energy. Every time I hear that, the explanation kinda stops at "it releases a crap ton of energy when it's hydrolyzed." I hear "the energy is used to move macromolecules against chemical gradients," but I never hear how that energy is harnessed. Like in highschool, you learn in photosynthesis how plants convert solar energy to usable energy, but it's never been explained to me how cells are able use that ATP hydrolysis energy for what they use it for.

Beautiful video! You did a great job depicting the bizarre adventure of life, and how fragile and complex it is from a physical standpoint. However, a bit of constructive criticism: It is obvious that you are simplifying things to make your videos more "accessible" for a younger audience, or an audience that isn't really involved in biology. And also, perhaps, to make your animations more appealing. But I think it would be good to try and avoid some depictions that might result in misconceptions, for example the channel proteins that are depicted as grapplers, picking molecules up and shoving them through a hole in the membrane.
I am aware that you must be facing thousands of design decisions for every video and that it is a ton of work. It's just that your videos, in my opinion, are by far the best and most inspiring ones, and misconceptions, as insignificant as they might seem, may make learning harder when a student has to learn that stuff later on. I'm studying to become a teacher, and I would love to show your videos to all of my students!

Fun fact: Humans have 2 sets of DNA.
The one is the DNA you got from both parents. The one your body uses for cell division.
The other is the one in your Mytochondria. You basically get a copy of your mothers Mythchondia - thus this DNA is purely based on your mother. Your cells just keep ordering them to duplicate, if they want to split into 2.

I don't think you've fully understood the concept of Entropy - or at least you've misrepresented it here. The universe doesn't want "life to be done with doing it's own thing" because living things increase the overall entropy of the universe much more quickly than non-living things would. Just compare the Earth to the moon - which of those bodies increases entropy more than the other? Right, Earth is basically an entropy machine, while the moon is just sitting there barely doing anything. So physics alone would need way too much time to increase the entropy of all those small planetary bodies - biology helps and therefore the universe wouldn't want it to stop.

The circulatory systems controls the blood and the digestive system controls you consuming food and transferring to energy. The integumentary system protects the inside of your body and the excretory system controls your bladder and stuff while the endocrine system controls your height and fight or flight response and more. And the muscular system controls your movement while the respiratory system helps you breath. All these things work together and it's amazing and very complex.
